7. The Four-Body Problem
The N particle OGS can be mapped to a single particle moving in N −1 dimensions
in a linear potential whose equipotential surfaces are that of an N −1 simplex. Since the
largest number of spatial dimensions that can be directly visualized is three, the N = 4
system—the four-body OGS—is of particular interest. Curiously, it has received almost no
attention– only the non-relativistic system has been studied [124]. The relativistic 4-body
system has yet to be investigated.
